content.description: Cruxy first two clips and suspect 4th clip through easy terrain (Reinforce with nuts/stoppers in nearby crack).  Hard, chossy start and suspect 4th bolt make this route only good for HELMET TOTING CHOSS WARRIORS.
content.protection: ~8 Quickdraws. Use extra long slings at anchor when rigging TR.
content.location: Highest Tier at end of the Upper Trail, or from Lower Trail, uphill and around the corner from Redneck Hole.  Up left of bulge, to the left of Gumption Gus.

content.description: Start low (30 feet below Redneck Hole) and climb arete.  Cruxy near clip #6. This is the first route to gain the entire cliff hieght.  Other stations accessible from above.
content.location: From upper tier hike up and right.  If accessing cliff from upper trail, be careful, the descent through Redneck Hole is steep & loosely vegetated 5.Easy.

content.description: Mixed route (2 clips) up far right side of bulge. Shares anchors with Prince Phi! Beware loose holds on lower section.
content.protection: Nuts, TCUs, and small cams for incipient cracks. 2 bolts.
content.location: Farthest route on the right side of the cliff.

content.description: Sport, mixed and TR.  Heady overhanging TR/projects in the Hole proper, but sport and mixed routes farther uphill. BEWARE, belays are steep on loose footing and HELMETS are a must for poor rock quality at this far uphill end of the cliff.  Please announce "ROCKFALL!"
